p: Plants are sources of various phytochemicals such as terpenes, phenylpropanoids, diarylheptanoids, isothiocyanates, and sulfur compounds. These natural compounds are often explored for their potential use. For example, phytochemicals produced by herbs and spices are of interest due to their culinary and medicinal uses. Some of the phytochemical functions include antioxidant activities, the modulation of detoxification enzymes, the enhancement of the immune system, the reduction of inflammation, the modulation of steroid metabolism, antiviral and antibacterial effects, and the oxidative retardation of lipids [ 1, 2]. Medicinal herbs can also be an alternative source of antioxidants outside of vitamin C, vitamin E, and carotenoids [ 3].
